review_blob: tap @ fenway. had this one around the holidays... nice spices, gingerbread, cinnamon flavors... but tricky brew to match with something else if youre also sitting down to eat. did go well with dessert.
bottle. this is a skunky disaster. left in my fridge from a party, I had nothing else to drink so I popped one open. i ended up giving the rest away. for a low cal brew--- this misses the mark.

although I havent been rating at all in the past months... I have been drinking plenty of this... its the first brew I found that my girlfriends will actually help me drink, thus creating a healthy buffer against becoming a full blown alcoholic.

and the alcohol is hidden oh so well.
bottle. good stuff indeed. nice thick aroma and palate. ripe fruits, figs, sweetness with warm alcohol undertones. plus i like the little doo-dad that comes around the neck of the bottle.

tap @ fenway. wowsers this can kick off a wild night. great to try before you have a final exam at 9am! citrus hints, warm, bitter, dry, alcohol, glad to try this one out... will be back soon for more.
tap @ fenway. hoppy holidays indeed. sweet, floral and spicey notes. aroma has hints of roasted marshmallows. warms ya up.

bottle. deep alcohol, chocolate, malty aroma... sip.... and roastiness, molasses, bittersweet dark chocolate flavor... a big yum that gets better as it warms up... pairs well with fine literature... i love this style, and this brew reminds me why... warms me up on a winter night
beer_name: Bear Republic Big Bear Black Stout

review_blob: bottle. i really enjoyed this. ruby color with an atomic bomb cloud head, sweet crisp flavors... light and oh so drinkable. a very refreshing escape from a rainy day.

bottle. dark with a thin tan head... i was expecting a little more. a little bit of a watery moutful. grapes/wine notes mixed into the smokey aroma... flavors a little bland... decent, but not my favorite that ive tried in this style

bottle. 1997 vintage. first thing that hits your nose is soy sauce... but give it some time and deep over ripe fruit, figs, aroma comes into play... okay... im afraid... here goes the taste... eeeeek.... soy sauce, hard liquor... its a good thing i was already eating chinese. this is strange. blech. i dont like it. one. bit.

bottle. strong nose and hoppy flavors mixed with hints of spice that result in a bit of a bitter finish... a beer that makes you thirsty...  i have to restrain myself from rated this a 20 overall because i was sipping it while a very sexy man had his hands and mouth all over my body... i think this is a fair rating... but then again he had such a very nice 6pack of his own

tap. last beer of the night, becuase im trying to look thin tomorrow night (although this washed down a cheeseburger and fries) because cute boy from the past and i have a "movie" night on saturday... and every one knows "movie" is code for hot and wild sex...ANYWAY... pale golden color... fluffy white head... wheaty nose with tangerine notes... tastes more fruity, reminds me of a cider/champagne

tap. dark cloudy root beer color... nice lacing... stronger candied yams, brown sugar, thick, woody... rip fruit, figs aroma... milky mouthful... tastes a little like a watered down oatmeal... nice mix of flavors, but not really my favorite batch of brew
tap. amber color, small head... very mild nose... nice sweet winter spices... not overpowering, sweet finish... i like this... just taste yummy!
tap. yummmmy. dark roasted espresso notes... i think i taste hints of root beer... soft flavors and creamy palate... very very very nice
tap. cloudy amber, off-white head... grassy/hoppy aroma and flavors... bitter aftertaste but still nicely balanced...
bottle. playfully hoppy... i would say it was more of a naughty elf than very bad... citus and earthy all at once... the name alone gives a couple of points to the overall rating
this was surprisingly tastey... nice caramel and malt notes... heats ya up right quick... had the pleasure of meeting Old Growth at Bauer... good times!
eh... another ordinary winter brew... bready, fruit with background eatrhiness... but nothing too exceptional here...
nice and mild in flavor, the santa on the label is giving a bit of a sketchy look... malty, caramel but a little watery on the palate
nice smooth, citurs notes, overall a very nice way to start the night until my friend couldnt get into bars cuz she has a PR id..psshhhh

200th rating.
bottle. dark brown hue, dark ripe fruit aromas, dark chocolate flavors, sweet and deep all around... thats monks mistress sure knew what she was doing... even better, this brew kicked off a wild night...

bottle. cloudy amber fluffy head. this was a little more hoppy than i expected... but i did enjoy. for some reason nothing necessarily strikes me, perhaos this is more of a classic brew archtype... this tastes a little more complex when it warms

tap. amber/copper color... aroma has hints of sweet toffeee, earthy, syrup... the flovors sweet/malty light hops, not what the aroma leads you to expect, a little watery IMO... tastes a little like a watered down pumpkin ale
tap. sexy appearance like a girl with a short skirt and a looong jacket... aroma of mocha chocolate and fresh coffee grounds, smooth creamy, milky mouthful... deep caresses
tap. brown with ruby hues, aroma of roasted macadamia nuts, pretty typical, a little watery, easy to drink but nothing to brag about
tap. deep amber color... nutmeg /cinn /spice aroma---flavor has notes of caramel and toffee, smooth moutful with a pumpkin pie background and some mild hoppiness
thanks to MrFacto for this bottle. pours like fizzy unfiltered apple juice. aroma: citrusy... flavors: bubbly bubbly banana, spice, malt, tart finish... refreshing in gloomy weather
bottle. oh shit. this is good. thank god, because i needed this. bad. thank you victory. makes watching King of the Hill a little classier....

tap. aroma smells like something from grandmas house... sweet, floral, doughy... caramels and hops in the flavor... slightly bitter aftertast... im sure that dog Ellie was very nice, but her brew didnt turn out so good

bottle. deep, cloudy, cherry wood with an off white soap sudsy head... wine/spice aroma... bittersweet unrequited love flavors that linger on the tongue (almonds?)... a milky mouthful... best enjoyed while watching  a great Hithcock movie... suggested flick: Vertigo.

tap. deep brownish/amber color... suprising mild aroma... complex flavors: caramel, hops, salt, spice, alcohol, citrus... im amazed i enjoyed this so much seeing im not a big fan of the super hopastic brews... well balanced, well done... dare i even say..."yum"
tap. deep smooth and a little smokey, sweet buttery flavors, chickory, malts, caramel.... IMO this was fuckin great!
tap. grapefruit very present in the aroma... spicey notes hit you first... the sweetness prevails in the bacground of the palate... WOW... i just saw the 9.9%... i couldnt taste that one bit!
bottle. stong aroma hits you tougher than the sour bite once you take a sip... sweet black cherries, tart on the tongue... for a kiss lip puckering

bottle. black is black is the hue of this brew. aroma is woody, coffee, bourbon... hits your nose strrrong... nice smooth moutful is not as overpowering as the aroma... like black coffee with brown sugar... nice ... very nice
bottle. what a nice thick head... pours smooth goes down smooth.. sweet aroma... with rich coffee espresso liquor flavor that turns slightly bitter at the end
500ml bottle. pale light golden color...pretty ordinary... bready with barely there citrus notes... nothing special
bottle. thanks to MrFacto for this gift. a cludy lemon color... citrus, tangerine, spice aroma... tart belgium flavors... very nice... bubbly and fun

bottle. nice amber color w more reddish hues... the aroma knocks you socks off filled with fresh gassy hoppy notes... but once it hits your tongue the flavor is much more sweet, malty and alcohol noted...
bottle. oil black with a dissapating tan head... aroma of chocolate, raspberries, dates makes this little nise happy... nice mouthful... not complex, i agree, but still damn tastey

bottle. the aroma was very very nice... toffee, mocha, smokey... the taste malt, caramel and a notes of blue cheese... interesting... i imagine this would go well with a nice cheese and cracker platter
bottle. that nice sexy brunette color... toffee and nutty aroma... flavor pretty ordinary.... sweet with a slight tang in the finish
bottle. light golden hue... sweet scents and flavors... reminds me of laying outside and watching the clouds pass by... delicate...
beer_name: La Choulette Bire des Sans Culottes

review_blob: cloudy reddish apple cider color with a vanilla colored head... bright, fruity aroma with musty notes... flavor sweet, tosted, (raisins?), with a slightly sour finish... very nice moutful... not too shabby at all

tap @ BBF. konabrewer helped me add this. slightly cloudy amber color with an off-white head, natural flavors... something like anise in there, the cadamom adds a touch of sweetness... (this brew is the base for Offshores Rye Not)... an overall interesting brew

tap. nice rich garnet/amber hue... aroma has hints of cocoa, caramel, malts... the sweetness os balanced by smokey undertones... much better than i expected... ill be trying it again this holiday season

tap. a pumpkiny winter warmer style... i like it, easy to drink with smooth maltiness... had this alone, and then in the second round i had 1/2 this and 1/2 guinness... which was apparently called "cinnamon toast"... an interesting combo
tap @ fenway. i did enjoy this one. a smooth offering from beer works, a good session brew. slick and malty... a barely noticible hop presence... but that doesnt bother me one bit.
bottle @ belgian beer fest. aroma of candied peaches and liquor... sweet, malty, not too shabby...
